newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singtel, Teleglobe to set up internet backbone network.
newsitem.headline: Singtel, Teleglobe to set up internet backbone network.

text.p: Singapore Telecommunications Limited (SingTel) and Teleglobe International Corporation have agreed to jointly provide one of Asia's largest 45 megabit per second internet backbone networks, a SingTel statement said on Monday.

The agreement will allow internet service providers (ISPs) in Singapore to provide faster and improved access to the global internet using Teleglobe's extensive and trade-marked "Globeinternet" routing services from April, it said.

Under the terms of the agreement signed in Hawaii on January 19, SingTel will invest around U.S. $13 million to buy additional bandwidth in the Asia-Pacific and trans-Pacific cable systems to carry internet traffic from Singapore to the U.S.
Teleglobe will provide the corresponding half of the international leased circuit, including internet sites in the U.S.
